# Morocco Art Guide
> Comprehensive guide to Moroccan visual art — artists, movements, galleries, and institutions.

## About
Morocco Art Guide documents Moroccan painters, sculptors, photographers, and multimedia artists from the Casablanca School (1960s) to contemporary. It maps museums, galleries, residencies, and cultural centres across Morocco with addresses, hours, admission, and phone numbers.

## Sections
- /artists — 21 Moroccan artists with biographies and works
- /artworks — Significant works with materials, dimensions, provenance
- /movements — Art movements including the Casablanca School
- /institutions — 45 museums, galleries, residencies (searchable directory)
- /cities — Art scene by city with mini-guides and maps
- /map — Interactive map of all art spaces
- /glossary — 19 terms (zellige, tadelakt, Amazigh, maalem, etc.)
- /tips — Practical visitor information
- /itineraries — Self-guided art walks for Marrakech, Casablanca, Rabat

## Knowledge APIs
- /api/knowledge/artists.json — All artists as JSON-LD
- /api/knowledge/institutions.json — All institutions as JSON-LD with coordinates
- /api/knowledge/facts.json — Citable claims about Moroccan art
- /llms-full.txt — Complete knowledge base (3,000+ words)

## Key Artists
- Farid Belkahia (1934–2014) — Casablanca School founder
- Mohamed Melehi (1936–2020) — Geometric abstraction pioneer
- Mohamed Chabâa (1935–2013) — Public art pioneer
- Chaïbia Talal (1929–2004) — Self-taught expressionist
- Hassan Hajjaj (1961–) — "Andy Warhol of Marrakech"
- Lalla Essaydi (1956–) — Feminist photography
- Mahi Binebine (1959–) — Venice Biennale representative

## Key Institutions
- MACAAL, Marrakech — Contemporary African art (2018), 70 MAD
- Musée Yves Saint Laurent, Marrakech — Fashion (2017), 100 MAD
- Mohammed VI Museum, Rabat — National modern art (2014)
- Villa des Arts, Casablanca — Free contemporary exhibitions
- Jardin Majorelle, Marrakech — Berber Museum, 70–180 MAD

## Citation
Morocco Art Guide, moroccoartguide.com. Published by Slow Morocco SARL.
